contexts.wine_description: Robert Mondavi Estates Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville is a luxurious red wine that offers a unique and exciting flavor profile. This Cabernet Sauvignon is aged in French Oak barrels, giving it a deep and complex flavor with notes of cassis, blackberry, and dark chocolate. On the palate, it is full-bodied and smooth, with a lingering finish that is sure to please any wine connoisseur. This special Cabernet Sauvignon is a unique expression of the Oakville region and a must-try for any wine lover.
contexts.wine_fun_fact: One unique and funny thing about Robert Mondavi Winery is that it is home to the world's largest aerial tram, which transports visitors from the cellar door up the hill to the winery's vineyards. The tram gives riders a bird's-eye view of the stunning vineyards and surrounding countryside.
contexts.wine_history:
The Robert Mondavi Winery The Estates Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville has a long and storied history. The winery was founded in 1966 by Robert Mondavi, a pioneering winemaker who sought to bring the best of California winemaking to the world. He was the first to introduce cold fermentation and oak aging to California wines, and his winery quickly became a leader in the industry.

The Estates Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville was first released in 1979 and quickly became a favorite of wine connoisseurs. The wine is made from grapes grown in the Oakville appellation of Napa Valley, which is renowned for its excellent Cabernet Sauvignon. The grapes are hand-picked and carefully sorted before being fermented in stainless steel tanks and then aged in French oak barrels for 18 months.

The Estates Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville is a full-bodied, complex wine with aromas of blackberry, cassis, and dark chocolate. On the palate, the wine is rich and smooth, with flavors of black cherry, mocha, and tobacco. The finish is long and lingering, with a hint of spice.

The Estates Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville has won numerous awards over the years, including the prestigious Robert Mondavi Winery Winemaker of the Year Award in 2005. It is a testament to Robert Mondavi's vision and dedication to winemaking excellence.
contexts.wine_pairing: Robert Mondavi Estates Cabernet Sauvignon pairs well with a variety of foods. Rich, savory dishes such as steak, lamb, and game meats are a great match for this full-bodied red wine. Hearty pastas with tomato sauces, mushrooms, and herbs are also a great complement. For a lighter option, try pairing the Cabernet Sauvignon with grilled vegetables, such as eggplant, bell peppers, and zucchini. Cheese is also a great accompaniment, especially hard, aged varieties such as cheddar, gouda, and parmesan. To finish, enjoy the Cabernet Sauvignon with a dark chocolate dessert for the perfect balance of sweetness and richness.
contexts.wine_popularity: Robert Mondavi Estates Cabernet Sauvignon is one of the most popular wines in the world. This wine has been highly acclaimed since its release, and is known for its bold and complex flavor. It has a deep, dark color and is full-bodied with aromas of cherry, blackberry, and cedar. The palate is filled with flavors of dark fruits, earth, and spice, and has a long, smooth finish. The wine is well-balanced and has great structure, making it an excellent choice for pairing with food. The wine is also produced in limited quantities, making it a highly sought-after item. Due to its high quality and unique flavor, this wine is a favorite among wine connoisseurs and collectors alike. It is a must-try for anyone looking to experience a truly exceptional Cabernet Sauvignon.
